channel.description:
Wasn't sure what to make the title other than just mining.. If someone wouldn't mind could they post their mining actionHandler. Such as.. [code] case ####: //MINING STUFF HERE break; [/code]
Not sure what they are for various rock types, and what the correct code to put inbetween the case and break; is. The reason being is that I downloaded a blank source and it doesn't have anything, I've been working hard to add everything, using a clean system. However, I have no idea how to go about starting mining.
Delta please, thanks! - The Web Guy.

item.title: [Delta] Mining
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Some common ways to store data for skills are using arrays and enums, as for the ActionHandler, you have to call the methods inside the class that handles the player mining. Also, read up on switch statements, so you can better understand exactly what the case: and break; is.

item.title: [Delta] Mining
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:2, topic:460672”]Normally it helps to break the process down into smaller and smaller steps, until you can put those steps into code. The process in this case would be

First iteration:
Add code to the server so that when a player clicks an ore object, it mines it.

But we can’t really convert that into code very easily, so we break it down again.

Add code to the Mining Handler for the specified rocks, at which point will perform an animation, and give the player ore, replacing the rock with an empty one.

Which is a bit better, but still not quite there, because we need to know which animation, for how long to play it, which ore to give the player, and experience to give the player, and replacing the object with an empty rock, depending on the type of the filled one.

Luckily for you, most of that information is in other servers, and you can pick and choose which parts you want, and change it to your needs.[/quote]

Did something very similar with Woodcutting, I’ll take your advice into consideration, thanks Zyle.

Which is a bit better, but still not quite there, because we need to know which animation, for how long to play it, which ore to give the player, and experience to give the player, and replacing the object with an empty rock, depending on the type of the filled one.
